utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is tour guide one any my name is Lynnette.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: This is participant number nine, Aimee.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um well I'm just planning to %uh visit Singapore and I'm wondering if you can help me out.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, and when do you plan to come in to Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm maybe %uh on the fourteenth of May.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh who will you be coming with?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I will be coming with my %uh best friend since it' s her birthday.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And that would be fourteenth of May, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, how many days do you plan to stay here?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um well, for about one to two days.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Fourteen of May will be on a Monday.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um %uh I suppose that we have a budget of %um more or less a hundred %uh Singaporean Dollar.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That is for one person or two person?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, a thousand dollars for two persons.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh what will be your age group be like?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You know in the range of?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: What would be your age group?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The range of your age group.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um we are both in our early twenties.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And what do you- do you have something in mind or what do you like to do both of you?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well actually we're thinking to go to %uh first %uh maybe visit the Universal Studios.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And %um actually we both enjoy %uh nature photography.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um we're wondering if %uh you could show us %uh where to go in %uh Singapore so %um %uh we can- oh we can %uh you know %uh we can get a good picture of your wildlife there or- and your nature.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh nature as in the birds or the plants?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um both the culture %um- anything about Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Both plants and %uh birds, is it?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um and do you have a hotel in mind?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you need to look for a hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So what I'm going to do here is I'm going to- show you this place.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And also- %um Lynnette, could you also %um please show me a %um %uh you know, my best friend and I really loves partying and %uh %um we're won- we're also wondering if there are %um clubs or %uh you know bars in Singapore that we can definitely go.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So do you want me to show you the gardens first?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is the Botanical Gardens in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can be there as early as five A.M. to twelve midnight but I guess you won't be spending that many hours there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah oh- well %um you know %uh taking photographs will be good %um for %uh around six o'clock in the morning and up to nine o'clock in the morning because of the %uh- %uh the natural colours will be great to the camera.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can be- anyway the park opens as early as five A.M.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, and anytime you are ready to leave, you can leave the gardens.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But if you have- if you plan to spend a bit more time, you can go to the Orchid Garden inside the Botanical Gardens.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But that is- there is an admission charge there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But the Orchid Garden only opens at eight thirty.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So do you know what you're going to see in the Orchid Garden?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um Orchids and- would there be any other plants there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But the Botanical Gardens, you will have all the other plants out in the Botanical Garden including a small jungle.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And there will be some birds %uh there as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is for the garden visit for your plants and a little bit of wildlife like the birds %uh so you can do that in the morning.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So is there any other information that you require for the %uh photography session?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I think that will be all.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Do you need me to tell you how to get there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now assuming that your hotel is somewhere in Orchard Road, there are buses available.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh there are quite a number of buses, it's all stated on the website.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, if you want to take the MRT train station- MRT, the subway trains.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um but what if we %uh take the MRT station?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do we have to take any other vehicles or we just have to walk?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You're actually right there- at the eco %uh garden.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is at the North end of the gardens.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, it's quite close to the garden already.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Otherwise if you %uh because there are many entrances and exit to the garden itself.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh it's fine, if you take the MRT, you can arrive at the %uh MRT %uh the Botanical Garden station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we can close this %uh website.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So next, we want to go to the %uh Universal Studio?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Can you please show me around?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, this is %uh some of the photos that you can get %uh to do when you see the %uh Hollywood characters.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um well I'm just gonna ask if the Universal Studios is near from the Botanical Garden.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you- it is %uh- the- so are you thinking of after your morning photography student- %uh studio %uh- photography session to proceed straight to the Universal Studio.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it is not that far away.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: What you can do is you go back on the MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you take the Circle Line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and you will alight at the HarbourFront.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: In HarbourFront, you will %uh get in using the %uh the Sentosa Express.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: To get into the Universal Studio.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um again after %uh we ride the MRT it is straight to the Universal Studios entrance so we don't have to ride another %uh another bus or any other vehicles.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no. From the Botanical Garden, it's %um MRT and you can change the Sentosa %uh train at HarbourFront.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that's how you can get in.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And straightaway when you alight %uh at the station %uh to- by taking the Sentosa Express, you're already at Universal Studio.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh it will be just about right because the opening hours, opens at ten A.M.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And also Lynnette %um do you know %uh how much will be the entrance fee there in Universal Studios?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's- okay it's sixty eight dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, and these are the rides that's available.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Are those rides %uh are those rides inclusive of the %uh entrance fee or do we have to pay %uh another %uh for that- for the rides?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: No. The- most of the rides are included unless they say that for example like the %uh Amber Rock Climb.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That's %uh additional charges for the children.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This one is for the children.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh otherwise most of the rides would be already included in your ticket.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh the- I think the Transformer ride is very interesting.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, so this is the Universal Studio.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And how much time do you think you want to spend there?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um well I think %um- well just before dinner.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So in the night time, you want to do %uh- you want to go to a bar.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can go to this very famous bar.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: These are some of the events, the past event.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Do you need me to tell you the dress code?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Dress code will be %uh party attire.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And because they have won %uh few years.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: For a number of years, they have won the nightspot of the year.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It's a pretty good place actually.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Perfect place for partying and clubbing.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And do you need me to tell you how to get there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Again it's quite accessible by the %uh subway train station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You just have to walk a little bit.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The closest station would be %uh at the Tiong Bahru MRT Train Station.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So actually it's a pretty big place and %um from the %um station- from the MRT Station %uh we can definitely see the lights from the club, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's about ten minutes' walk from the MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Well, you don't have the lights out there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's %uh pretty %uh simple on the outside so you don't see like a lot of %uh new lightings.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But it is %uh one of almost %uh world famous club %uh in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you want to party %uh this will be one of the nightspot.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Another club that I can %uh recommend you will be called okay, this is the other %uh club.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, that %uh we have in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Which is again pretty %uh popular with the local as well as the tourists.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %uh the %uh what do you call this?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um %uh at what usual time does the op- you know the clubs open at night?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, usually people would start going in by ten o'clock.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And it finish late like till two A.M.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is about the usual time that people goes to the club.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And the other %uh club that I like to introduce you would be called One-Altitude.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is %uh- you have top of the world feeling.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is- it's actually a bar.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It's really %uh a pretty nice bar.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You got a good view %uh from the top of the building.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um and how do we get there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, again this is very accessible by the MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Raffles Place MRT and it's just right there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay so you have two clubs to go to already.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is it- and also Lynnette %um we also plan on the second day %uh if you happened to know- %um where we can buy %uh branded clothes but, you know, for cheaper prices.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We have along Orchard Road lots of shopping.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And also if you can please show me %um how to get there %uh from our hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me just show you this.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now this is a shopping complex called Paragon.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it is located on Orchard Road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And the closest MRT train station would be called Orchard Station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's just five minutes' walk from Orchard Station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is one option, other the other option- so you have all the branded goods out there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And because you are a tourist, now, when you buy something from a bigger company.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh remember to get the GST tax refund.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's the- it's the VAT, you know?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But we call it GST here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It stands for Goods and Services Tax.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay when you get the form %uh you can always claim back the seven per cent upon %uh you leaving Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh and %um where do I claim that?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now if you are going to put your purchases in your handbag

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You will check-in as usual at the check-in counters.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: After you get your boarding pass, you go inside the immigration.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Immediately after the immigration, you will be able to see a big sign that says GST.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, just approach counter with your purchases and your %uh receipt alright, that has been stamped %uh by the retailer and you present this to the officer.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And they will be able to refund you, your money in whatever currency you wish.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or to %uh mail back the %uh refund to you via your %uh credit card to credit back your GST %uh to your credit card.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you want to put your purchases in your luggage, then it's slightly different.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um well do you have- do I have to go to the %uh- straight to the immigration and %um you know, refund the GST again to that counter or would there be any other process for that?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: What you can do is your purchases are going to be put inside your luggage when you arrived in the airport-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: at both ends of %uh at one end of the airport area, you will find a GST counter.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now bring your purchases, your %uh receipt to the- and of course your passports and tickets.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And bring it to the officer that's located there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Present all these items and the officer will do a stamp for you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay now, bring everything to do your normal check-in at the check-in counter.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Once you have done your check-in with your boarding pass, proceed into the immigration counter And you look for the GST sign again and you will be able to get back your tax refund.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that's how you claim back the GST.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, thank you for that Lynnette.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And- okay, so this is one %uh shop but to the shopping again for your branded goods.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This would be one of the options.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I think the prices here for branded goods are still %uh very competitive.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now another shopping centre, you may want to consider would be a nice shopping centre called ION.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: In the %um- is it close to the %uh Paragon Shopping Centre?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Again this is just- this is even nearer to the Orchard MRT Train Station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: When you exit from the MRT %uh this is the shopping centre.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Now well if I'm coming from the %uh Paragon Shopping Centre.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh do I have to ride anything or we can get there by just walking?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, just a five minutes' walk.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you are just very close-by to one another.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And do you want me to recommend another shopping centre for you?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: You know because my best friend really love shopping and

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is another shopping centre here called Ngee Ann City.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, it's just again on Orchard Road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you have Ion, then you have another shopping centre called Wisma Atria.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you have this big shopping centre called Ngee Ann City.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so does your friend only wants to do %uh shoes, the branded shoes?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um well actually %um any kind of clothing.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um %uh from dresses %uh blouses, t-shirts, you know, oh for souvenirs also.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, there is a sh- %uh on the ground floor, there is a shop that sell some %uh local souvenir.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can get some %uh souvenirs out there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, otherwise I have given you the categories of the shops that is found in %uh Ngee Ann City.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So for example if you are looking for %uh fashion accessories.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, these are all the various shops that has all the fashion.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, can you see from high fashion?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh midrange kind of leather goods will be U.R.S. Okay, On Pedder.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, the rest are high-end branded goods.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh so %um I think we can definitely find everything that %um we want to buy there at Ngee Ann City.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh what kind of food do you like?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um %uh actually we would like to try Singaporean foods.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Then you go to next door called Wisma Atria.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can try some of our local street food out there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm and %um- well actually we don't have any idea what to try there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um %uh you know, I was wondering if you do have %uh one in mind that you can definitely %uh refer us to try.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The Wisma Atria is called %uh Food Republic.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and one of the local food that I would like to recommend you would be Fried Hokkien Noodles.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um oh was that- I'm sorry, I didn't get that.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So basically what is it made of?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh this is actually made out of the yellow kind of noodles.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can show you how it's done- Hokkien Noodles.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Wow, it has prawn on it.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I think that would be perfect because we both love seafoods.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So basically we fry this %uh dish

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh okay, I think we have enough of the food otherwise we get too hungry.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, and now what's %uh- so let's go back to %uh Paragon again.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that's too %uh attract you to try this local food out here that is very popular in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh of course we have a lot more %uh dishes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh for example we have satay in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's a meat- different kind of meat that is pierced through a skewer and it's barbecued over %uh charcoal.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That is something you want to consider as well.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh let me put that on my list.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And of course our very famous %uh chicken rice.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um would that all- I guess that will be %uh that will cover up our two days trip in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh do you still need to do some more photography session?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um %uh well, do you have any place- %uh any more places %um- besides the Botanical Garden that %uh you know, that's great for %um photography?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We have another place called %uh the %uh Sungei Buloh or even Bukit Timah Hill.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Do you like to do a little bit of %uh climb?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I can recommend you Bukit Timah Hill.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And basically what are the %uh you know what can I basically see there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, Bukit Timah Hill is Singapore tallest hill.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh again, there are lots of flower and fauna.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: A bit of %uh a bird's life.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But I would say it's small birds and fauna.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And it is popular with the local who goes for the morning or evening walk up the hill.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And %um also, how do we get there %um- assuming we're coming from the %um hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You will have to take a bus.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because right now the MRT is not ready at this moment.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you will have to take a bus to go there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay this is %uh just a photo scene.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh of course, you will get to see some monkeys as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so- and- You will have to take a bus called %uh bus one seven zero from Orchard Road.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And %um how long would it take to get there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh allocate about %uh forty minutes bus ride.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Weighting time approximately about fifteen minutes to get to this park.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well %um- well Lynnette, I think %uh that will be all %uh for %uh our two days trip in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And %um basically that will cover most of %um our trip.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And %uh- and also %uh by the way %uh just one more thing.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh do you have any place %uh well I have- I've heard this from my %uh from my sister's friend because they've been to Singapore %uh a place called Little India.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, we have this place called Little India.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh this is a ethnic area in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So traditionally %uh the Indians used to live here in the past

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, I'm just going to show you some images of Little India.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh on what kind of market are you talking about?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Pretty much %uh any kind of market like %uh anything goes around there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There is a wet market in Little India MRT Train Station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh they sell- it's like a non-air conditioned supermarket.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So all the stores sells meat, vegetables, flowers %uh and they open till twelve o'clock in the afternoon.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there is the market if- I understand what do you mean by market.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So would you want to try some Indian food?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now I'm going to show you this food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you would pick the different dishes that's %uh available in the store.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And the vendor, the food centre will cook for you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And they serve you with this orange coloured gravy.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It' just a tinge of %uh spice in there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh so it's like everything mixed together so we call this Indian rojak.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Are you also %uh do you want to eat other things-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is that also an Indian food?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's a kind of bread made from wheat flour.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And there's also other kinds of bread like %uh curry naan.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, this is the picture of the bread, the naan.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, you can eat it plain, you can have garlic naan.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's actually taste quite good on its own.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can dip them with curry.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can have another version %uh of like pancake, Indian pancake that's called %uh roti prata.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So these are quite typical %uh Indian food that we have here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I think you may also get good pictures down in Little India.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: With all the colours and also %uh Lynnette can you please show me %uh around at %um Sentosa?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now Sentosa %uh Universal Studio is in Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So basically it's %um it's a city there and %uh what else can I find there besides from the Universal Studios?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's a whole island of %uh recreational %uh activities that you can do there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so you have the beach.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, can you see the bottom part?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um can you please %um %uh show me around the beach.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We have a few beaches out here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I like to show you this Pahlawan Beach.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, this is the beach out on Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, these are basically lagoon so %uh the %uh it's a nice place and you can see people also playing %uh beach volleyball.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So and %um also- how do we get there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can- if you're on Universal Studio, you can just take the beach %uh the Sentosa Express, the train on Sentosa and you alight at the beach station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, and you're at the beach.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it is better to do %uh Universal Studio together with the attractions on Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And also what other- %uh aside from beaches what %um other activities can we %um find at Sentosa?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, can you see the- a number of spas there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Would you- do you like to do spa?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The mon- %uh there are about five spas that's available %uh on the %uh island itself.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm well I think that %uh %um I'm pretty curious about the Fish Reflexology Underwater World.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, this %uh fish reflexology, it's %uh like a foot massage.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So these fishes will actually eat up all your %uh so called %uh dead skin.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And they- so what you will feel is this nibbling, ticklish %uh sensation.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So what the fish do is they nibble at your ni- dead skin.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I think we'll gonna try that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So the cost, do you want to know the cost?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now, this %uh they have different time %uh kind of %uh package.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, if it's %uh forty minutes, that would cost you thirty eight dollars per session.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh fifty minutes will cost you fifty two dollars per session.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And that fifty minutes %um includes the full fee of the reflexology and also the massage?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no, it's just the %uh fish nibbling at your feet.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is the fish reflexology over at the %uh Underwater World.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The %uh- there are other %um- for the- if you want to do this fish reflexology %uh you can actually combine it with going into the Underwater World.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because %uh they charge for %uh the- okay, can you see now?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The fishes are- you dip your feet into this pool and the fishes would nibble at your %uh feet.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And of course if you want to do body massage, these are the various %uh %uh centres that you can %uh do your body massage.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well %um also in that %uh just popped up in my mind.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh can you please %um %uh- what about the %uh Night Safari?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Night Safari %uh opens in the night time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It is located in the North of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: you will have to take %uh MRT and a bus.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is the %uh Night Safari.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That's also great for %um our photographing session.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: When you are inside the park because this is a park that opens in the night time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh if you want to take photography %uh you would have to take it without flash.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, for- if you're taking on the animals, then you have to take that without the flash.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And also Lynnette %uh do we have an entrance fee for that?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Just for the %uh Night Safari Park, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But basically Lynnette, what are- what do I- what should I expect to see %h in the Night Safari?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh in the Night Safari, you would see %uh things like %uh the giraffes-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So these are the things that you're going to see in the %uh Night Safari Park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It should cost you about seventy %uh two dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh you don't have to walk in the park if you don't want to.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh %uh there is a %uh what do you call that, Safari ride?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can get on the tram ride and %uh you will see more than seventy per cent of the animals.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And %um the- is it included in the %uh ticket?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, the tram ride is included in the ticket.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The whole ride will cost you forty minutes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright. It will take about- it will take you forty minutes to go around the park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and if you don't want to take the tram, you can do walking as well.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm but will I be ab- if I- if we choose to walk, would we able to see %um you know, the %uh the animals also?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are three trail, that's one that you're looking at.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh on this trail, of course you see other animals but the highlight would be to see the Leopard's Trail.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There is another called the Fishing Cat Trail.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh this is located near the entrance area.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And also %um Lynnette, could you please %um %uh tell me more about the shows there at Night Safari?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, one is called the %uh- okay, this show here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The first picture that you saw, okay, is the fire show.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and the other one would be the Creatures of the Night.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That's what you're looking at now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is the %uh- okay, this is the Creature of the Night.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now basically it's a twenty minute show %uh and they will just bring out some animals for you to see.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The show timing would be in %uh at seven thirty, eight thirty and nine thirty %uh provided it is not raining.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the other show, the fire show will be at eight o'clock and nine o'clock.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And that the fire show is located outside the park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So once you get into the Night Safari, you have to buy the tickets.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can buy without the tram ride if you want to.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh but I would recommend that you take the tram %uh and the walk.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %uh so we just gonna %um walk through the Safari all our- all by ourselves or do we have any guides there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: In the tram ride, there will be a person a guide doing the commentary.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh what animals you are looking at.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But on the walk %uh you will be doing the walk by yourself.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Get to see about %uh more than seventy per cent of the animals.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And the balance of thirty per cent, you will have to do the walk to see the rest of the show.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %uh will there be any more %um sites, you know, there in Night Safari?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no more sites at the Night Safari but in the day time-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: we have the morning zoo which is next door.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the morning zoo opens in the day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you will be seeing a lot of the mammals.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: For example %uh the orang-utans, the chimpanzees.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That can only be seen in the day zoo but not in the Night Safari.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But %uh are we allowed to take pictures of them?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because the day zoo, it's only open in the day and the day, you wouldn't require the flashlights, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But %uh during the Night Safari, we are allowed to take %um pictures but with no flash.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You are allowed to take pictures of the animals without flash.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But if you are going to just take your friends and plants or the entrance area %uh then it is fine with the flash.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I think %uh we have covered- %uh do you have like %uh you know %uh more or less covered what you think you would like to do in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um well I think %uh we pretty much covered our two days trip in Singapore %um. And %uh we really are excited to go there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we hope to see you %uh soon in %uh Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh thank you so much for your help, Lynnette.
